  4411                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4412                                  
  4413                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4414                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4415                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4416                                  
  4417                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4418                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4419                                  		;=============================================================
  4420                                  		;
  4421                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4422                                  		;
  4423                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4424                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4425                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4426                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4427                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4428                                  
  4429                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4430                                  		;=============================================================
  4431                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4432                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4433                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4434                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4435                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4436                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4437                                  		
  4438 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4439                                  
  4440                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4441                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4442                                  		;push	ax
  4443                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4444                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4445                                  		;pop	ax
  4446                                  	
  4447                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4448                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4449                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4450                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4451                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4452                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4453                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4454                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4455                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4456                                  
  4457                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4458                                  
  4459                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4460                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4461                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4462                                  
  4463 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4464 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4465                                  
  4466                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4467                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4468                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4469                                  
  4470 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4471 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4472 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4473 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4474                                  
  4475                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4476                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4477                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4478                                  		; ds = cs
  4479 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4480 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4481                                  		; ds = 0
  4482                                  
  4483 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4484                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4485                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4486                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4487 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4488                                  next_int_:		
  4489 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4490 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4491                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4492 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4493 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4494 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4495 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4496 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4497                                  					; saving address in di
  4498 00001794 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4499 00001795 AB                      		stosw
  4500 00001796 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4501 00001797 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4502 00001798 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4503 0000179A E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4504 0000179C 5F                      		pop	di
  4505 0000179D 59                      		pop	cx
  4506                                  
  4507                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4508                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4509                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4510                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4511                                  
  4512                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4513                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4514                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4515                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4516                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4517                                  
  4518                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4519 0000179E C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4520                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4521                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4522 000017A4 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4523                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4524 000017A8 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4525                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4526                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4527 000017AE 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4528                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4529 000017B2 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4530                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4531                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4532 000017B8 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4533                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4534                                  
  4535                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4536 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4537 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4538                                  		
  4539 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4540 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4541 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4542 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4543                                  					; ;
  4544 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4545 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4546                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4547                                  
  4548                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4549                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4550                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4551                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4552                                  ;
  4553                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4554                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4555                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4556                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4557                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4558                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4559                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4560                                  
  4561                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4562                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4563                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4564                                  ;
  4565                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4566                                  ; to do anything special.
  4567                                  ;
  4568                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4569                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4570                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4571                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4572                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4573                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4574                                  
  4575                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4576 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4577                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4578 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4579                                  
  4580                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4581                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4582                                  ;
  4583                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4584                                  ;
  4585                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4586                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4587                                  
  4588 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4589 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4590 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4591 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4592 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4593 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4594 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4595 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4596 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4597                                  					; DL = drive number
  4598                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4599                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4600                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4601 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4602                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4603                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4604                                  		; ds = cs
  4605 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4606                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4607 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4608 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4609 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4610 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4611 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4612 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4613 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4614                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4615                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4616                                  
  4617                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4618                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4619                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4620                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4621 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4622 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4623 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4624                                  
  4625                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4626                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4627 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4628 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs

  4630                                  
  4631                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4632                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4633 000017F5 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4634 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4635                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4636                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4637                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4638 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4639                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4640                                  
  4641                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4642 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4643 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4644                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4645                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4646                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4647 00001801 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4648 00001803 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4649 00001805 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4650                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4651                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4652                                  		; ds = cs
  4653 00001806 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4654                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this

  4657                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4658                                  					; booted off hard file
  4659 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4660                                  
  4661                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4662                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4663                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4664                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address

  4720                                  					; AKPORT
  4721                                  
  4722                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4723                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running

  4733 00001855 A820                    		test	al, 20h

  4735 00001859 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4736 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al
  4737 0000185D E450                    		in	al, 50h

  5024                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5025                                  ; diskette drives:
  5026                                  ;
  5027                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5028                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5029                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5030                                  ;
  5031                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5032                                  ;
  5033                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5034                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5035                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5036                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5037

  5047                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5048                                  
  5049                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5050                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5051                                  
  5052                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5053                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5054                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5055                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5056                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5057                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5058                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5059                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5359                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5360                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5361                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5362                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5376                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5377                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table

  5379                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5380                                  ;
  5381                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5382                                  ;
  5383                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5384                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5385                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5386                                  ;use to start with.
  5387                                  ;
  5388                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5389                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5390                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5391                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5392                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  5465                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the

  5467                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5468                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5469                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5470                                  ; off of it.

  5472                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have

  5474                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5475                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5680

  5684                                  	;	mov	[cs:md_sectorsize], bx	; used by get_fat_sector proc.

  5686                                  	;				; get size of fat on media

  5691                                  	;	;sub	es:16D8h, ax

  5693                                  	;				; need a logical sector number that will

  5702 00001C23 891E[D816]              		mov	[md_sectorsize], bx ; used by get_fat_sector proc.

  5709                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  5710                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)

  5713                                  	; ------

  5717                                  	; the boot program has left the directory at 0:500h

  5755                                  
  5756                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5757                                  ;
  5758                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5759                                  
  5760                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5761                                  
  5762                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5763                                  ; module name: remap
  5764                                  ;
  5765                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5766                                  ;
  5767                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5768                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5769                                  ;
  5770                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5771                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5772                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5773                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5774                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5775                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5776                                  
  5777                                  ; input:       none
  5778                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5779                                  ; exit error:  none
  5780                                  ; called from: msinit
  5781                                  ;
  5782                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5783                                  ;	  found in the system
  5784                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5785                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5786                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5787                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5788                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5789                                  ;
  5790                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5791                                  
  5792                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5793                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5794                                  
  5795                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5796 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5797                                  
  5798                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5799                                  
  5800                                  drive_loop:				
  5801 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5802                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5803 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5804 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5805                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5806 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5807 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5808 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5809                                  
  5810                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5811                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5812                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5813                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5814                                  
  5815                                  fdrv_found:				
  5816 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5817                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5818 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5819                                  					; found	??
  5820 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5821                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5822                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5823                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5824 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5825 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5826 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5827                                  
  5828                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5829                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5830                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5831                                  ; any more.
  5832                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5833                                  
  5834 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5835                                  					; get first bds
  5836 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5837                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5838 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5839 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5840                                  remap_loop1:				
  5841 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5842                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5843 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5844 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5845 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5846 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5847                                  
  5848                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5849                                  
  5850 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5851 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5852 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5853 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5854 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5855                                  
  5856                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5857                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5858                                  
  5859 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5860 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5862                                  
  5863                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5864                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5865                                  
  5866                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5867 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5868                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5869 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5870 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5871 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5872 00001CD1 BF5804                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5873                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5874 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5875 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5876                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5877                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5878 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5879                                  rmap_exit:				
  5880 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5881                                  
  5882                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5883                                  
  5884                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5885                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5886                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5887                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5888                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5889                                  ;**************************************************
  5890                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5891                                  ;
  5892                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5893                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5894                                  ;
  5895                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5896                                  ;**************************************************
  5897                                  
  5898                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5899                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5900                                  
  5901                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5902                                  		
  5903                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5904                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5905                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5906                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5907                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5908                                  
  5909 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5910 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5911                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5912 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5913                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5914                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5915 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5916 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5917 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5918 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5919                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5920                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5921                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5922 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5923                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5924 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5925                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5926                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5927 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5928                                  erret:					
  5929 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5930                                  norm_ret:				
  5931 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5932                                  
  5933                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5934                                  
  5935                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5936                                  
  5937                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5938                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5939                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5940                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5941                                  ;   determine version number
  5942                                  ;
  5943                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5944                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5945                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5946                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5947                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5948                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5949                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5950                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5951                                  
  5952                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5953 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5954 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5955 00001CFD 1E                      		push	ds
  5956 00001CFE 06                      		push	es
  5957 00001CFF 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5958 00001D02 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5959 00001D05 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5960                                  					; fnon_removable
  5961 00001D09 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5962                                  					; ffHardFile
  5963 00001D0D C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5964 00001D12 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5965 00001D14 52                      		push	dx
  5966 00001D15 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5967 00001D17 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5968                                  					; DL = drive number
  5969                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5970                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5971                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5972 00001D19 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5973 00001D1B 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5974 00001D1E 5A                      		pop	dx
  5975 00001D1F 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5976 00001D21 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5977 00001D24 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5978 00001D27 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5979 00001D28 E8B0FF                  		call	getboot
  5980 00001D2B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5981 00001D2C 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5982 00001D2E BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5983                                  
  5984                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5985                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5986                                  
  5987                                  act_part:				
  5988 00001D31 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5989 00001D36 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5990 00001D38 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5991 00001D3C 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5992 00001D3E 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5993 00001D42 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5994 00001D44 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5995 00001D48 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  5996                                  got_good_act:				
  5997 00001D4A 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  5998 00001D4C 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  5999 00001D4E FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6000                                  no_act:					
  6001 00001D50 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6002 00001D53 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6003                                  					; last entry done?
  6004 00001D57 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6005 00001D59 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6006                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6007                                  
  6008                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6009                                  
  6010                                  get_primary:				
  6011 00001D5C 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6012 00001D61 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6013                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6014 00001D63 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6015 00001D67 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6016 00001D69 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6017 00001D6D 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6018 00001D6F 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6019 00001D73 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6020                                  got_prim:				
  6021 00001D75 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6022 00001D77 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6023 00001D79 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6024                                  not_prim:				
  6025 00001D7B 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6026 00001D7E 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6027 00001D82 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6028                                  setret:					
  6029 00001D84 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6030 00001D85 E9E002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6031                                  
  6032                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6033                                  
  6034                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6035                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6036                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6037                                  ;
  6038                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6039                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6040                                  ;  without change.
  6041                                  ;
  6042                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6043                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6044                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6045                                  
  6046                                  set2:					
  6047 00001D88 2E8816[D716]            		mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6048                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6049 00001D8D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6050 00001D91 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6051

  6139                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6140                                  ; into cs:disksector area.

  6142                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6143                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.

  6148                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6149                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6150 00001E2F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6151 00001E32 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6152                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6153                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6154                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6155                                  
  6156                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6157                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6158                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.

  6164 00001E3D 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6165 00001E3F 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6166 00001E43 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no

  6422 00001F29 8B451B                  		mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6423 00001F2C 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6424 00001F2F EB06                    		jmp	short fat_big_small
  6425                                  
  6426                                  		;mov	cx, dx
  6427                                  		;or	cx, ax		; see if it is a big zero

  6429                                  copy_totsec:

  6431                                  					; make DPB match boot sec

  6442

  6470                                  					; # root entries

  6477                                  					; dx:ax	now contains the
  6478                                  					; # of data sectors

  6481                                  					; sectors per cluster

  6483                                  					; set in bios bpb

  6489                                  					; # clusters.

  6577 00001FE5 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6578                                  
  6579                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6580                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6581                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6582                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  6589 00001FF0 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus

  6600                                  
  6601                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  6602                                  
  6603                                  dobig:					
  6604 00002005 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6605 00002007 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6606 00002008 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6607 0000200B D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6608 0000200D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6609 0000200F 5A                      		pop	dx
  6610 00002010 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6611 00002013 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6612 00002016 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6613                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6614 00002019 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6615 0000201B 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6616                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6617                                  
  6618                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6619                                  
  6620                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6621                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6622                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6623                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6624                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6625                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6626                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6627                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6628                                  		
  6629 0000201E 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+2
  6630 00002020 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  6631 00002023 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+1
  6632 00002026 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6633                                  
  6634                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6635                                  
  6636 00002029 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6637                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6638 0000202B 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6639                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6640                                  
  6641                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6642                                  
  6643                                  		;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  6644                                  		; 17/10/2022

  6646 00002032 885D1F                  		mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  6647                                  
  6648 00002035 1E                      		push	ds
  6649 00002036 1E                      		push	ds

  6662                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6663                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6664                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6665                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6666                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6667                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.

  6718                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.

  6762                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6763                                  
  6764                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6765                                  
  6766                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6767                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6768                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6769                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  6770                                  ;
  6771                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  6772                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  6773                                  
  6774                                  setdrvparms:
  6775 000020B3 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6776                                  		; 18/10/2022
  6777 000020B5 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds in list
  6778                                  _next_bds:				
  6779 000020B9 06                      		push	es
  6780 000020BA 57                      		push	di
  6781 000020BB 268A5D22                		mov	bl, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
  6782 000020BF 80FB05                  		cmp	bl, 5		; ffHardFile
  6783 000020C2 753E                    		jnz	short nothardff
  6784 000020C4 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6785 000020C6 268B450E                		mov	ax, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
  6786 000020CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  6787 000020CC 7508                    		jnz	short get_ccyl
  6788 000020CE 268B551D                		mov	dx, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6789 000020D2 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6790                                  
  6791                                  get_ccyl:				
  6792 000020D6 52                      		push	dx
  6793 000020D7 50                      		push	ax
  6794 000020D8 268B4515                		mov	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  6795 000020DC 26F76513                		mul	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6796                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.
  6797 000020E0 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax		; cx has # sectors per cylinder
  6798 000020E2 58                      		pop	ax
  6799 000020E3 5A                      		pop	dx		; dx:ax	= total	sectors
  6800 000020E4 50                      		push	ax
  6801 000020E5 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6802 000020E7 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6803 000020E9 F7F1                    		div	cx
  6804 000020EB 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; ax be	0 here.
  6805 000020EF 58                      		pop	ax
  6806 000020F0 F7F1                    		div	cx		; div #sec by sec/cyl to get # cyl.
  6807 000020F2 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  6808 000020F4 7401                    		jz	short no_cyl_rnd ; came out even
  6809 000020F6 40                      		inc	ax		; round	up
  6810                                  
  6811                                  no_cyl_rnd:				
  6812 000020F7 26894525                		mov	[es:di+25h], ax	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
  6813 000020FB 06                      		push	es
  6814 000020FC 1F                      		pop	ds
  6815 000020FD 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec]
  6816                                  					; ds:si	-> bpb for hard	file
  6817 00002100 EB51                    		jmp	short set_recbpb
  6818                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6819                                  
  6820                                  nothardff:				
  6821 00002102 0E                      		push	cs
  6822 00002103 1F                      		pop	ds
  6823                                  
  6824                                  ; if fake floppy drive variable is set then we don't have to handle this bds.
  6825                                  ; we can just go and deal with the next bds at label go_to_next_bds.

  6827                                  		; 10/12/2022

  6831                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  6832 00002109 7450                    		jz	short go_to_next_bds

  6836                                  process_other:

  6838 00002112 8B4525                  		mov	ax, [di+25h]	; [di+BDS.cylinders]
  6839 00002115 F76536                  		mul	word [di+36h]	; [di+BDS.rheads]
  6840 00002118 F76534                  		mul	word [di+34h]	; [di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
  6841 0000211B 89452F                  		mov	[di+2Fh], ax	; [di+BDS.rtotalsecs16]
  6842                                  					; have the total number of sectors
  6843 0000211E 48                      		dec	ax
  6844 0000211F B201                    		mov	dl, 1
  6845                                  _again:					
  6846 00002121 3DF60F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF6h	; 4096-10
  6847 00002124 7206                    		jb	short _@@
  6848 00002126 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  6849 00002128 D0E2                    		shl	dl, 1
  6850 0000212A EBF5                    		jmp	short _again
  6851                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6852                                  
  6853                                  _@@:					
  6854 0000212C 80FA01                  		cmp	dl, 1		; is it	a small	disk ?
  6855 0000212F 7405                    		jz	short __@@	; yes, 224 root	entries	is enuf
  6856 00002131 C7452DF000              		mov	word [di+2Dh], 240 ; [di+BDS.rdirentries]
  6857                                  __@@:					
  6858 00002136 885529                  		mov	[di+29h], dl	; [di+BDS.rsecperclus]
  6859                                  
  6860                                  ; logic to get the sectors/fat area.
  6861                                  ; fat entry is assumed to be 1.5 bytes!!!
  6862                                  
  6863                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6864                                  		; ds = cs
  6865                                  		; 17/10/2022 (ds=cs)
  6866 00002139 F726[AF20]              		mul	word [word3]
  6867 0000213D F736[AD20]              		div	word [word2]
  6868 00002141 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6869 00002143 F736[B120]              		div	word [word512]
  6870                                  		;
  6871                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6872                                  		;mul	word [cs:word3]	; * 3 ; mul word [cs:word3]
  6873                                  		;div	word [cs:word2]	; / 2 ; div word [cs:word2]
  6874                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  6875                                  		;div	word [cs:word512] ; / 512 ; div word [cs:word512]
  6876                                  		;
  6877 00002147 40                      		inc	ax		; + 1
  6878                                  no_round_up:
  6879 00002148 894532                  		mov	[di+32h], ax	; [di+BDS.rfatsecs]
  6880 0000214B EB0E                    		jmp	short go_to_next_bds
  6881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6882                                  
  6883                                  not_process_other:			
  6884 0000214D D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1		; bx is	word index into	table of bpbs
  6885                                  		;mov	si, bpbtable
  6886                                  		;mov	si, [bpbtable+bx] ; 15/10/2022
  6887                                  		; 09/12/2022
  6888                                  		;mov	si, BPBTABLE
  6889                                  		;mov	si, [bx+si]	; get address of bpb
  6890                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6891                                  		;mov	si, [BPBTABLE+bx]
  6892                                  		; 13/12/2022
  6893 0000214F 8BB7[8E51]              		mov	si, [SYSINITOFFSET+bpbtable+bx]
  6894                                  set_recbpb:				
  6895 00002153 8D7D27                  		lea	di, [di+27h]	; [di+BDS.R_BPB]
  6896                                  					; es:di	-> recbpb
  6897 00002156 B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; bpbx.size
  6898 00002159 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; move (size bpbx) bytes	
  6899                                  go_to_next_bds:				
  6900 0000215B 5F                      		pop	di
  6901 0000215C 07                      		pop	es		; restore pointer to bds
  6902 0000215D 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
  6903 00002160 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; -1
  6904 00002163 740A                    		jz	short got_end_of_bds_chain
  6905 00002165 E951FF                  		jmp	_next_bds
  6906                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6907

  6954                                  
  6955                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  6956                                  ;
  6957                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  6958                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  6959                                  ;
  6960                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  6961                                  ;
  6962                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  6963                                  ;   initialize it.
  6964                                  ;
  6965                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  6966                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  6967                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  6968                                  ;
  6969                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  6970                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  6971                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  6972                                  ;
  6973                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  6974                                  ;   save coding.
  6975                                  ;
  6976                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  6977                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  6978                                  ;
  6979                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  6980                                  ;
  6981                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  6982                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  6983                                  ;
  6984                                  ; called modules:
  6985                                  ;		  getboot
  6986                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  6987                                  ;
  6988                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  6989                                  ;
  6990                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  6991                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  6992                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  6993                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  6994                                  ;
  6995                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6996                                  
  6997                                  		; 19/10/2022
  6998                                  domini:	
  6999 00002179 8A36[5117]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7000                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7001 0000217D 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  7002                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  7003 0000217F 7431                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  7004 00002181 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7005                                  domini_loop:				
  7006 00002183 52                      		push	dx
  7007 00002184 8816[5017]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7008 00002188 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7009 0000218A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7010                                  					; DL = drive number
  7011                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7012                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7013                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7014 0000218C FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7015 0000218E 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  7016 00002190 88F0                    		mov	al, dh
  7017 00002192 A3[5617]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  7018 00002195 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  7019 00002198 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  7020 0000219A A3[5817]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  7021 0000219D 06                      		push	es
  7022 0000219E 8A16[5017]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7023 000021A2 E836FB                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  7024                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias
  7025 000021A5 7203                    		jb	short domininext
  7026 000021A7 E80900                  		call	find_mini_partition
  7027                                  domininext:				
  7028 000021AA 07                      		pop	es
  7029 000021AB 5A                      		pop	dx
  7030 000021AC FEC2                    		inc	dl		; next hard file
  7031 000021AE FECE                    		dec	dh
  7032 000021B0 75D1                    		jnz	short domini_loop
  7033                                  dominiret:				
  7034 000021B2 C3                      		retn
  7035                                  
  7036                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7037                                  
  7038                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7039                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7040                                  
  7041                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  7042                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry
  7043                                  ;		es:bx -> 07c0:bootbias - master boot record
  7044                                  ;		rom_minidisk_num - rom drive number
  7045                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  7046                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7047                                  ;
  7048                                  ;called routine: setmini which uses set2 (in sethard routine)
  7049                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat
  7050                                  
  7051                                  
  7052                                  find_mini_partition:	
  7053 000021B3 81C3C201                		add	bx, 1C2h	; bx ->	file system id
  7054                                  fmpnext:				
  7055 000021B7 26803F05                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 5 ; 5 = extended partition id.
  7056 000021BB 740A                    		jz	short fmpgot
  7057 000021BD 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7058 000021C0 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7059 000021C4 75F1                    		jnz	short fmpnext
  7060                                  		;jmp	short fmpnextfound ; extended partition	not found
  7061                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7062                                  fmpnextfound:
  7063 000021C6 C3                      		retn
  7064                                  
  7065                                  ;		; 30/07/2019 - Retro DOS v3.2
  7066                                  ;		jb	short fmpnext
  7067                                  ;fmpret:
  7068                                  ;		retn	; 29/05/2019
  7069                                  
  7070                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7071                                  
  7072                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7073                                  fmpgot:					; found my partition.				
  7074 000021C7 E8A100                  		call	dmax_check	; check	for drvmax already 26
  7075 000021CA 73FA                    		jnb	short fmpnextfound ; done if too many
  7076 000021CC 8B3E[5417]              		mov	di, [end_of_bdss] ; get next free	bds
  7077 000021D0 C745470100              		mov	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  7078                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7079 000021D5 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1
  7080                                  		;or	word [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  7081                                  					; fNon_Removable
  7082 000021D9 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  7083                                  					; ffHardFile
  7084 000021DD C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit fat.
  7085 000021E2 A1[5617]                		mov	ax, [mini_hdlim]
  7086 000021E5 894515                  		mov	[di+15h], ax	; [di+BDS.heads]
  7087 000021E8 A1[5817]                		mov	ax, [mini_seclim]
  7088 000021EB 894513                  		mov	[di+13h], ax	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7089 000021EE A0[5017]                		mov	al, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7090 000021F1 884504                  		mov	[di+4],	al	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  7091                                  					; set physical number
  7092 000021F4 A0[7500]                		mov	al, [drvmax]
  7093 000021F7 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  7094                                  					; set logical number
  7095 000021FA 26837F0A00              		cmp	word [es:bx+10], 0
  7096 000021FF 7707                    		ja	short fmpgot_cont
  7097 00002201 26837F0840              		cmp	word [es:bx+8], 64 ; with current bpb,
  7098                                  					; only lower word is meaningful.
  7099 00002206 72BE                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  7100                                  					; should be bigger than 64 sectors at least
  7101                                  fmpgot_cont:				
  7102 00002208 83EB04                  		sub	bx, 4		; let bx point to the start of the entry
  7103 0000220B 268A7702                		mov	dh, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder
  7104 0000220F 80E6C0                  		and	dh, 0C0h	; get higher bits of cyl
  7105 00002212 D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7106 00002214 D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7107 00002216 268A5703                		mov	dl, [es:bx+3]	; cyl byte
  7108 0000221A 895549                  		mov	[di+49h], dx	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  7109                                  					; set hidden trks
  7110 0000221D 268B4F02                		mov	cx, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder,cylinder/sector
  7111 00002221 268A7701                		mov	dh, [es:bx+1]	; head
  7112 00002225 8A16[5017]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7113 00002229 BB0002                  		mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  7114 0000222C B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  7115 0000222F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  7116                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  7117                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  7118                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  7119 00002231 7293                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  7120 00002233 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  7121 00002236 06                      		push	es
  7122 00002237 E80900                  		call	setmini		; install a mini disk.
  7123                                  					; bx value saved.
  7124 0000223A 07                      		pop	es
  7125 0000223B 7203                    		jb	short fmpnextchain
  7126 0000223D E84000                  		call	xinstall_bds	; -- install the bdsm into table
  7127                                  fmpnextchain:				
  7128 00002240 E974FF                  		jmp	fmpnext		; let's find out
  7129                                  					; if we	have any chained partition
  7130                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7131                                  
  7132                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7133                                  ;fmpnextfound:				
  7134                                  		;retn
  7135                                  
  7136                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7137                                  
  7138                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7139                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
  7140                                  
  7141                                  setmini:	; 'setmini' is called from 'find_mini_partition' procedure
  7142                                  	
  7143 00002243 57                      		push	di
  7144 00002244 53                      		push	bx
  7145 00002245 1E                      		push	ds
  7146 00002246 06                      		push	es
  7147                                  setmini_1:				
  7148 00002247 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; FAT12 partition
  7149 0000224B 741B                    		jz	short setmini_2
  7150 0000224D 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4 ; FAT16 partition
  7151 00002251 7415                    		jz	short setmini_2
  7152 00002253 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6 ; FAT16 BIG	partition
  7153 00002257 740F                    		jz	short setmini_2
  7154 00002259 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7155 0000225C 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7156 00002260 75E5                    		jnz	short setmini_1
  7157 00002262 F9                      		stc
  7158 00002263 07                      		pop	es
  7159 00002264 1F                      		pop	ds
  7160 00002265 5B                      		pop	bx
  7161 00002266 5F                      		pop	di
  7162 00002267 C3                      		retn
  7163                                  
  7164                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7165                                  setmini_2:				
  7166 00002268 E91DFB                  		jmp	set2		; branch into middle of sethard
  7167                                  
  7168                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7169                                  
  7170                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7171                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7172                                  ;
  7173                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  7174                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  7175                                  ;		a drive letter left.
  7176                                  ;
  7177                                  ;	drvmax < 26 : carry SET!
  7178                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  7179                                  ;			trash ax
  7180                                  
  7181                                  dmax_check:	
  7182 0000226B 803E[7500]1A            		cmp	byte [drvmax], 26 ; checks for drvmax < 26
  7183 00002270 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  7184 00002272 06                      		push	es
  7185                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7186 00002273 B85804                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022	
  7187 00002276 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  7188                                  		; 18/10/2022
  7189 00002278 26C606[FF03]01          		mov	byte [es:TOOMANYDRIVESFLAG], 1 ; 09/12/2022 
  7190                                  		;mov	byte ptr es:3FFh, 1 ; [es:toomanydrivesflag]
  7191                                  					; set message flag
  7192                                  					; [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag]
  7193 0000227E 07                      		pop	es
  7194                                  
  7195                                  		;;push	es
  7196                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  7197                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  7198                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7199                                  					; set message flag
  7200                                  		;;pop	es
  7201                                  		;
