 12949                                  ; 17/10/2022
 12950                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12951                                  
 12952                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 12953                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 12954                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 12955                                  
 12956                                  win386call:				
 12957 00001340 1E                      		push	ds
 12958 00001341 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 12959                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 12960                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 12961 00001346 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 12962                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 12963 00001348 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 12964 0000134A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 12965                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 12966 0000134C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 12967                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12968 0000134E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 12969                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12970 00001351 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12971                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 12972 00001353 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 12973 00001358 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 12974                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12975                                  
 12976                                  Win386Init:	
 12977                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12978 0000135A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 12979                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 12980 0000135D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 12981                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 12982 0000135F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 12983                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 12984                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 12985 00001364 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 12986 00001368 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 12987                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 12988 0000136C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 12989 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 12990 00001370 07                      		pop	es
 12991                                  win_iret:				
 12992 00001371 1F                      		pop	ds
 12993                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 12994 00001372 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 12995                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12996                                  
 12997                                  handle_multmult:			
 12998 00001374 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 12999 00001376 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 13000 00001378 1E                      		push	ds
 13001 00001379 E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13002                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13003                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13004                                  		;dec	bx
 13005 0000137C BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13006 0000137F 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13007 00001381 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13008 00001383 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13009 00001385 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13010 00001387 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13011 00001389 43                      		inc	bx
 13012                                  try_1:					
 13013 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13014 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13016                                  
 13017                                  try_2:					
 13018 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13019 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13020 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13021                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13022                                  		;xor	di, di
 13023                                  		;dec	di
 13024 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13025 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13026 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13027 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13028 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13029 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13030 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13031 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13032                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13033                                  		;sub	di, di
 13034                                  		;dec	di
 13035 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13036 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13037                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13038                                  
 13039                                  try_4:					
 13040                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13041 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13042 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13043                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13044                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13045 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13046                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13047 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13048 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13049 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13050                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13051                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13052                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13053 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13054                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13055                                  try_3:		
 13056 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13057                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13058                                  
 13059                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13060                                  ;try_3:					
 13061                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13062                                  
 13063                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13064                                  
 13065                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13066                                  
 13067                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13068                                  ;
 13069                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13070                                  ;
 13071                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13072                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13073                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13074                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13075                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13076                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13077                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13078                                  ;
 13079                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13080                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13081                                  ;
 13082                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13083                                  
 13084                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13085                                  HMAPtr:
 13086 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13087                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13088 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13089                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13090 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13091 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13092 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13093                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13094 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13095 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13096                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13097 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13098                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13099                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13100 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13101                                  
 13102                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13103                                  
 13104                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13105                                  
 13106                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13107                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13108                                  
 13109                                  move_sector:
 13110                                  
 13111                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13112                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13113                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13114                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13115                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13116                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13117                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13118                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13119                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13120                                  ;
 13121                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13122                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13123                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13124                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13125                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13126                                  
 13127 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13128 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13129 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13130 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13131 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13132 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13133 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13134 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13135 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13136 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13137                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13138                                  
 13139                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13140 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13141 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13142 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13143 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13144                                  
 13145                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13146                                  
 13147                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13148                                  
 13149                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13150                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13151                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13152                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13153                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13154                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13155                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13156                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13157                                  ;
 13158                                  ; input conditions:
 13159                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13160                                  ;
 13161                                  ; output:
 13162                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13163                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13164                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13165                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13166                                  
 13167                                  check_wrap:	
 13168 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13169 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13170 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13171 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13172 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13173 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13174                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13175 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13176                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13177 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13178 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13179 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13180 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13181 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13182 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13183 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13184                                  
 13185                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13186                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13187                                  
 13188 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13189 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13190                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13191 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13192 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13193                                  					; if on	boundary
 13194                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13195                                  not_on_bound:				
 13196 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13197 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13198 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13199 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13200 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13201 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13202 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13203                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13204 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13205 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13206 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13207 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13208 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13209                                  
 13210                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13211                                  
 13212 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13213 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13214 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13215                                  
 13216                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13217                                  
 13218 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13219 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13220 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13221                                  no_head_bound:				
 13222 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13223 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13224 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13225 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13226 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13227 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13228 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13229 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13230 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13231 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13232 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13233 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13234 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13235 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13236                                  no_wrap:				
 13237 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13238 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13239 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13240 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13241 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13242 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13243                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13244                                  
 13245                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13246 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13247 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13248 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13249                                  
 13250                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13251                                  
 13252                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13253                                  
 13254                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13255                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13256                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13257                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13258                                  ;
 13259                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13260                                  
 13261                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13262                                  find_bds:	
 13263 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13264                                  fbds_1:					
 13265 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13266 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13267 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13268                                  					; go to next bds
 13269 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13270 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13271 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13272                                  fdbs_2:					
 13273 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13274                                  
 13275                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13276                                  
 13277                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13278                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13279                                  doint:
 13280                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13281 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13282                                  					; get physical drive number
 13283                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13284                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13285                                  		
 13286 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13287 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13288 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13289                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13290 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13291                                  					; get request code
 13292                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13293 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13294                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13295 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13296                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13297                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13298 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13299                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13300                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13301 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13302                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13303 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13304                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13305                                  dointdone:				
 13306 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13307                                  
 13308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13309                                  
 13310                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13311                                  
 13312                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13313                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13314                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13315                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13316                                  ;
 13317                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13318                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13319                                  ;
 13320                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13321                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13322                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13323                                  
 13324                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13325                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13326                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13327                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13328                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13329                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13330                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13331                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13332                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13333                                  ;end struc
 13334                                  
 13335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13336                                  
 13337                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13338                                  ;	ah = function
 13339                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13340                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13341                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13342                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13343                                  ;   output conditions:
 13344                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13345                                  
 13346                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13347                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13348                                  ;
 13349                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13350                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13351                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13352                                  
 13353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13354                                  
 13355                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13356                                  
 13357 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13358                                  
 13359                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13360                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13361                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13362                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13363                                  
 13364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13365                                  
 13366                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13367                                  
 13368                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13369                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13370                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13371                                  
 13372                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13373 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13374 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13375 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13376 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13377 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13378 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13379 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13380                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13381                                  
 13382                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13383                                  
 13384                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13385                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13386                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13387                                  
 13388                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13389                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13390 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13391 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13392 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13393 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13394 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13395 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13396 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13397 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13398 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13399 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13400 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13401                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13402 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13403 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13404                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13405 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13406                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13407                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13408 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13409 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13410 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13411                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13412                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13413 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13414 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13415 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13416                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13417                                  
 13418                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13419                                  
 13420                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13421                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13422                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13423                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13424                                  
 13425                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13426 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13427                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13428 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13429 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13430                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13431 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13432                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13433 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13434 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13435                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13436                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13437 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13438                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13439                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13440 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13441 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13442                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13443                                  
 13444                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13445                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13446                                  
 13447                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13448                                  
 13449                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13450                                  
 13451                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13452                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13453                                  
 13454                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13455 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13456                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13457                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13458 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13459                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13460                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13461                                  
 13462                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13463                                  
 13464 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13465 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13466 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13467                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13468                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13469 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13470 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13471                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13472                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13473                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13474 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13475                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13476                                  		
 13477 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13478                                  		
 13479 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13480                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13481 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13482                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13483                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13484 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13485 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13486                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13487 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13488 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13489                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13490                                  
 13491                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13492                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13493                                  ; a changeline error.
 13494                                  
 13495                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13496 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13497                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13498 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13499 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13500 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13501 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13502 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13503 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13504                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13505                                  					; never	would
 13506 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13507 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13508 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13509 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13510                                  int13b:					
 13511 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13512 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13513                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13514                                  
 13515                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13516                                  
 13517                                  goterr13:				
 13518 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13519 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13520                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13521 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13522 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13523 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13524 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13525                                  
 13526 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13527                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13528                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13529                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13530 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13531                                  
 13532 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13533                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13534                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13535 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13536                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13537                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13538 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13539 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13540 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13541 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13542 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13543 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13544 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13545 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13546                                  loop_ecc:				
 13547 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13548                                  
 13549                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13550                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13551                                  ;
 13552                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13553                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13554                                  ; track.
 13555                                  ;
 13556                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13557                                  ; this request.
 13558                                  ;
 13559                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13560                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13561                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13562                                  ;
 13563 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13564                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13565                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13566 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13567                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13568 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13569 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13570 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13571 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13572 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13573                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13574                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13575                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13576 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13577                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13578                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13579                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13580                                  ok11_op:				
 13581 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13582 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13583 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13584                                  					; add 200h to address
 13585 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13586 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13587 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13588                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13589                                  
 13590                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13591                                  
 13592                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13593 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13594                                  ok11_exit:				
 13595 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13596 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13597 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13598 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13599                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13600                                  
 13601                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13602                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13603                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13604                                  
 13605                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13606 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13607 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13608 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13609 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13610 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13611 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13612                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13613                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13614 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13615                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13616 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13617 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13618 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13619 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13620 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13623                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13624                                  
 13625                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13626 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13627 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13628 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13629 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13630 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13631 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13632 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13633 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13634                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13635                                  
 13636                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13637                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13638                                  
 13639                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13640 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13641 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13642 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13643 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13644                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13645                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13646 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13647 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13648 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13649 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13650 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13651                                  
 13652                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13653                                  
 13654                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13655                                  
 13656 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13657 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13658 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13659 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13660 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13661 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13662 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13663 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13664 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13665 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13666 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13667 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13668 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13669                                  
 13670                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13671                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13672                                  
 13673 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13674 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13675                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13676                                  
 13677                                  no_skip_first:				
 13678 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13679 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13680 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13681                                  
 13682                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13683                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13684                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13685                                  ;
 13686                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13687                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13688                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13689                                  ; in error.
 13690                                  
 13691 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13692 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13693                                  
 13694                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13695                                  
 13696 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13697                                  					; set up head number
 13698 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13699 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13700                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13701                                  
 13702                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13703 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13704 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13705 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13706                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13707                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13708                                  
 13709                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13710                                  
 13711                                  intverify:				
 13712 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13713 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13714 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13715 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13716                                  dosimple:				
 13717 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13718                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13719                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13720                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13721 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13722                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13723 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13724 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13725 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13726                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13727                                  
 13728                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13729                                  
 13730                                  intformat:				
 13731 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13732 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13733 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13734 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13735 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13736                                  
 13737                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13738                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13739                                  
 13740 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13741 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13742 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13743 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13744 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13745 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13746 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13747 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13748 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13749 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13750 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13751                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13752                                  
 13753                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13754                                  ; the first block.
 13755                                  ;
 13756                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13757                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13758                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13759                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13760                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13761                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13762                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13763                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13764                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13765                                  
 13766                                  doblock:
 13767                                  
 13768                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13769                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13770                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13771                                  				
 13772 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13773                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13774 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13775 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13776 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13777                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13778 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13779 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13780                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13781 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13782                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13783 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13784 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13785 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13786 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13787 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13788 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13789                                  doblockflop:				
 13790 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13791                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13792 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13793 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13794 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13795 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13796 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13797                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13798                                  
 13799                                  doblocklast:				
 13800 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13801 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13802                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13803 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13804 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13805 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13806 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13807                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13808 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13809 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13810 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13811 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13812 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13813                                  					; then we are done already.
 13814 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13815                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13816 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13817 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13818                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13819                                  
 13820                                  bufferx:				
 13821 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13822                                  					; set up head number
 13823                                  buffer:					
 13824 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13825 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13826 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13827 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13828                                  					
 13829                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13830                                  
 13831 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13832 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13833 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13834 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13835 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13836 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13837 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13838 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13839 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13840 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13841 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13842 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13843 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13844                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13845 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13846 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13847 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13848                                  
 13849                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13850                                  
 13851 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13852                                  					; get drive number
 13853 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13854 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13855                                  					;
 13856                                  					; ah is	function
 13857                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13858                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13859                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13860                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13861                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13862 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13863 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13864 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13865 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13866                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13867                                  
 13868                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13869                                  
 13870                                  doread:					
 13871 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13872 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13873 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13874 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13875 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13876 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13877 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13878                                  					; get drive number
 13879 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13880                                  					; ah = function
 13881                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13882                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13883                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13884 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13885 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13886 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13887 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13888 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13889 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13890 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13891 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13892 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13893 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13894 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13895                                  
 13896                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13897                                  
 13898                                  dotail:					
 13899 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13900 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13901 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13902 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13903 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13904 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13905 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13906                                  
 13907                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13908                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13909                                  
 13910 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13911 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13912 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13913                                  
 13914                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13915                                  
 13916                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13917                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13918                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13919                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13920                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13921                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13922                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13923                                  
 13924                                  bad13:					
 13925 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13926 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13927 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13928 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13929 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13930 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13931 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13932 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13933                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13934                                  
 13935                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13936 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13937                                  
 13938                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13939                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13940                                  		;db 	0
 13941                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13942                                  
 13943                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 13953                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13954 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13955 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13956 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13957 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13958 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13959                                  
 13960                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13961                                  
 13962                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13963                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13964                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13965                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13966                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13967                                  
 13968                                  install_bds:		
 13969 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 13970 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 13971                                  
 13972                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 13973                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 13974                                  loop_next_bds:				
 13975 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 13976                                  					; fetch	next bds
 13977 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13978 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 13979                                  					; drive	with new one?
 13980 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 13981 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 13982 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13983                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 13984 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13985 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 13986                                  					; we don't own it
 13987 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13988                                  					; determine if changeline available
 13989 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 13990 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13991                                  next_bds:				
 13992 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 13993                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 13994 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 13995 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 13996                                  					; install bds
 13997 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 13998 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 13999                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14000 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14001                                  
 14002                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14003                                  ;
 14004                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14005                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14006                                  ;
 14007                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14008                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14009                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14010                                  ;
 14011                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14012                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14013                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14014                                  
 14015 0000172B C3                      		retn

 14122                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14123                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
 14124                                  ;	   zero reset if open files
