 15249                                  
 15250                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15251                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15252                                  
 15253                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15254                                  
 15255                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15256                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15257                                  ;
 15258                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15259                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15260                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15261                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15262                                  ;
 15263                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15264                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15265                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15266                                  
 15267                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15268                                  
 15269                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15270                                  
 15271                                  struc	DPB
 15272 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15273 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15274 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15275 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15276 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15277 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15278 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15279 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15280 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15281 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15282                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15283 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15284 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15285 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15286 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15287 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15288                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15289 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15290 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15291 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15292                                  .size:
 15293                                  endstruc
 15294                                  
 15295                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15296                                  
 15297                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15354                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15355                                  
 15356                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15357                                  ;
 15358                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15359                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15360                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15361                                  ;
 15362                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15363                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15364                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15365                                  ;
 15366                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15367                                  
 15368                                  struc A_BPB
 15369 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15370 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15371 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15372 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15373 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15374 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15375 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15376 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15377 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15378 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15379 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15380 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15381 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15382 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15383 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15384                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15385                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15386                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15387                                  .size:
 15388                                  endstruc
 15389

 15392 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15393 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15394 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1

 15647                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15648                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15649                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15650                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15651                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15652                                  									  
 15653                                  ;*******************************					  
 15654                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15655                                  ;*******************************					  
 15656                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15657                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15658                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15659                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15660                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15661                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15662                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15663                                  ;For all others:							  
 15664                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15665                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15666                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15667                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15668                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15669                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15670                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15671                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15672                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15673                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15674                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15675                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15676                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15677                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15678                                  ;									  
 15679                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15680                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15681                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15682                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15683                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15684                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15685                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15686                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15687                                  ;									  
 15688                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15689                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15690                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15691                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15692                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15693                                  ;									  
 15694                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15695                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15696                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15697                                  ;									  
 15698                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15699                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15700                                  ;									  
 15701                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15702                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15703                                  ;									  
 15704                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15705                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15706                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15707                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15708                                  ;						called. 		  
 15709                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15710                                  ;									  
 15711                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15712                                  ;									  
 15713                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15714                                  ;									  
 15715                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15716                                  ;									  
 15717                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15718                                  ;									  
 15719                                  
 15720                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15721                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15722 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15723 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15724                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15725 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15726 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15727 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15728 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15729                                  endstruc

 15734                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b

 15838                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15839                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15841                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15842                                  
 15843                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15844                                  ;
 15845                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15846                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15847                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15848                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15849                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15850                                  ;
 15851                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15852                                  ;
 15853                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15854                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15855                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15856                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15857                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15858                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15859                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15860                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15861                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15862                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15863                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15864                                  
 15865                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15866                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15867                                  
 15868                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15869                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15870 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15871 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15872 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15873 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15874 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15875 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15876                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15877 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15878 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15879 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15880                                  .size:
 15881                                  endstruc
 15882                                  
 15883                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15884                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15885                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15886                                  						; argument
 15887                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15888

 15898                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15899                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15900                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15901                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15902                                  
 15903                                  ; system file table
 15904                                  
 15905                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15906                                  ;
 15907                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15908                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15909                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15910                                  
 15911                                  struc	SF
 15912 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15913 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15914 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15915                                  .size:
 15916                                  endstruc
 15917                                  
 15918                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15919                                  ;
 15920                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15921                                  
 15922                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15923 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15924                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15925 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15926 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15927 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15928                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15929                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15930                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15931                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15932                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15933                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15934                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15935                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15936                                  					;
 15937                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15938                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15939                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15940                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15941                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15942                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15943                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15944                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15945                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15946                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15947                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15948                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15949 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15950                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15951                                  					; points to net device header if
 15952                                  					; remote
 15953 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15954                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15955 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 15956 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15957 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15958 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15959                                  ;
 15960                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15961                                  ; ID
 15962                                  ;
 15963 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15964 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 15965 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 15966                                  ;
 15967                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 15968                                  ;
 15969 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 15970                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 15971                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 15972                                  					; disk changed errors.
 15973                                  ; SHARING INFO
 15974 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 15975 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1

 16253                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16254                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16260                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16261                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16262                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16263                                  
 16264                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16265                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16266                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16267                                  
 16268                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16269                                  ;
 16270                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16271                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16272                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16273                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16274                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16275                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16276                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16277                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16278                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16279                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16280                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16281                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16282                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16283                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16284                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16285                                  ;
 16286                                  
 16287                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16288                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16289                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16290                                  ;
 16291                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16292                                  ;
 16293                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16294                                  ;
 16295                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16296                                  ;
 16297                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16298                                  ;
 16299                                  
 16300                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16301                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16302                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16303                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16304                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16305                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16306                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16307                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16308                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16309                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16310                                  
 16311                                  		;EVEN
 16312                                  ;align 2
 16313                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16314                                  
 16315 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16316 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16317 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16318 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16319 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16320 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16321                                  
 16322 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16323 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16324 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16325                                  
 16326                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16327                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16328                                  
 16329                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16330                                  
 16331 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16332                                  
 16333                                  int02:
 16334                                  
 16335                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16336                                  ;
 16337                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16338                                  ;
 16339                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16340                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16341                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16342                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16343                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16344                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16345                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16346                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16347                                  ;
 16348                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16349                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16350                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16351                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16352                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16353                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16354                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16355                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16356                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16357                                  ;
 16358                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16359                                  
 16360 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16361 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16362 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16363 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16364                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16365 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16366 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16367 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16368                                  
 16369 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16370                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16371                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16372                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16373                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16374 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16375 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16376                                  special02:
 16377 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax

 16609                                  
 16610                                  ;********************************************************************
 16611                                  ;common routines
 16612                                  ;********************************************************************
 16613                                  
 16614                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16615                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16616                                  ; service routine
 16617                                  
 16618                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16619                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16620                                  
 16621                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16622                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16623                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16624                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16625                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16626                                  
 16627                                  do_int_stacks:
 16628 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16629 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16630 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16631 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16632 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16633 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16634                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16635                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16636                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16637 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16638 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16639 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16640                                  
 16641 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16642                                  
 16643                                  found02:
 16644 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16645 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16646                                  
 16647 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16648                                  
 16649 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16650                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16651                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16652                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16653                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16654 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16655 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16656                                  
 16657                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16658                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16659                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16660                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16661                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16662                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16663                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16664                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16665                                  
 16666                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16667 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16668 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16669 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16670 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16671 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16672 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16673 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16674 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16675                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16676                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16677 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16678                                  
 16679 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16680                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16681 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16682                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16683                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16684                                  
 16685 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16686                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16687 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16688                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16689                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16690 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16691 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16692                                  
 16693                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16694                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16695                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16696 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16697 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16698                                  
 16699 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16700 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16701 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16702 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16703 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16704                                  
 16705                                  notfree02:
 16706 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16707 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16708                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16709                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16710                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16711 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16712                                  
 16713                                  findnext02:
 16714 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16715 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16716                                  
 16717                                  foundbad02:
 16718 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16719 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16720 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16721                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16722                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16723                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16724 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16725 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16726                                  
 16727                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16728                                  
 16729                                  ; Common routines
 16730                                  
 16731                                  longpath:
 16732                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16733 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16734                                  lploopp:
 16735                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16736                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16737                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16738 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16739 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16740                                  
 16741 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16742                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16743                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16744                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16745 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16746 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16747 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16748                                  
 16749 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16750 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16751                                  
 16752                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16753                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16754                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16755 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16756                                  inuse:
 16757 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16758 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16759 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16760 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16761                                  found:
 16762 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16763                                  fatal:

 16766 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16767 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?

 16769 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16770

 16772 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16773

 16776 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints

 17473                                  ; This call to DOSINIT will relocate the DOS data from its present location
 17474                                  ; at the top of memory, to its final location in low memory just above the
 17475                                  ; BIOS data. It will then build important DOS data structures in low 
 17476                                  ; memory following the DOS data. It returns (among many other things) the
 17477                                  ; new starting address of free memory.

 17966                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17967                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17968                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17969                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17970                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17971                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17972                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17973                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17974                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17975                                  ;
 17976                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17977                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17978                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17979                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17980                                  ; been patched.

 18266 000007DD BA[D534]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18267                                  
 18268                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18269                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18270                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18271                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18272                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18273                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18274                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18275                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18276                                  
 18277                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18278

 18280 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18283 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC

 18286

 18292                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18293                                  
 18294                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18295                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18296                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18297                                  
 18298                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18299                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18301 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18302                                  
 18303                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18304                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18305                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18306                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18307                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18308                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18309                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18310                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18311                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18312                                  ;
 18313                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18314                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18315                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18316                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18317                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18318                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18319                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 18566                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18567                                  ;
 18568                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18569                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18570                                  ;
 18571                                  ; Inputs : None
 18572                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18573                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18574                                  ;	   free memory.
 18575                                  ;
 18576                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18577                                  ;
 18578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 18661                                  ;
 18662                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18663                                  ;
 18664                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18665                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18666                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18667                                  ;
 18668                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18669                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18670                                  ; 
 18671                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18672                                  
 18673                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18674                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)

 18684                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18685                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18686                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18687                                  	; ds = cs

 18690                                  ;	..

 18704                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18705                                  ;
 18706                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18707                                  ;
 18708                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18709                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18710                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18711                                  ;
 18712                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18713                                  ;
 18714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18715                                  
 18716                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18717                                  MovDOSHi:
 18718                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18719                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18720                                  	; ds = cs
 18721 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18722 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18723 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18724 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18725                                  
 18726                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18727                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18728                                  
 18729                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18730                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18731                                  	
 18732                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18734                                  
 18735                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18736                                  	
 18737                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18738                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18739                                  	;xor	di,di
 18740                                  	
 18741                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18742                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18743                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18744                                  	; ds = cs
 18745 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18746 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18747                                  
 18748                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18749                                  ;else
 18750                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18751                                  ;

 18817                                  ;
 18818                                  ;		Moves DOS code into requested area
 18819                                  ;
 18820                                  ;	In : ES:DI - pointer to memory where DOS is to be moved
 18821                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved
 18822                                  ;
 18823                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after DOS
 18824                                  ;

 18859                                  						;  DOS was moved

 18882

 18952                                  ;		Moves DOS code into requested area
 18953                                  ;

 18955                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved
 18956                                  ;
 18957                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after DOS
 18958                                  ;

 18987                                  	rep	movsb
 18988                                  
 18989                                  	pop	ds ; *// ; 11/12/2022
 18990                                  
 18991                                  	pop	bx				; get back offset into which
 18992                                  						;  DOS was moved

 19008

 19011                                  	; ds = cs

 19079                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19080                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19081                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19082                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19083                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19084                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19085                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19086                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19087                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19088                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19089                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19090                                  ;
 19091                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19092                                  
 19093                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19094                                  update_arena:
 19095 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19096 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19097 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19098 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19099                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19100                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19101                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19102                                  	; ds = cs 
 19103 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19104 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19105 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19106                                  						;  before sysvar
 19107 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19108                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19109 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19110 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19111 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19112                                  
 19113                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19114 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19115 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19116 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19117 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19118 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19119                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19120 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19121                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19122 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19123 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19124                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19125 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19126 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19127                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19128                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19129 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19130 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19131 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19132 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19133 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19134 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19135                                  ;
 19136                                  ; M012 : END
 19137                                  ;

 19155                                  ;
 19156                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19157                                  ;
 19158                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19159                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19160                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19161                                  ;
 19162                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19163                                  ;
 19164                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19165                                  
 19166                                  AllocHMA:
 19167                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19168                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19169                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19170                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19171                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19172                                  
 19173                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19174                                  ;
 19175                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19176                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19177                                  ;	push	ax
 19178                                  ;	popf
 19179                                  ;	pushf
 19180                                  ;	pop	ax
 19181                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19182                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19183                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19184                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19185                                  
 19186                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19187                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19188                                  
 19189 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19190                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19191                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19192                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19193 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19194 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19195                                  
 19196 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19197 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19198                                  
 19199 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19200 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19201                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19202                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19203                                  
 19204 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19205                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19206 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19207                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19208                                  
 19209 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19210 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19211                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19212 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19213 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19214 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19215                                  
 19216                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19217                                  
 19218 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19219 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19220                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19221                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19222                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19223 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19224                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19225                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19226 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19227                                  allocHMA_1:
 19228 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19229                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19230 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19231 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19232 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19233                                  
 19234 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19235 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19236                                  
 19237 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19238 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19239 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19240 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19241                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19242                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19243 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19244                                  
 19245                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19246                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19247                                  ;	; cf=0
 19248                                  ;	;clc
 19249                                  ;	pop	ds
 19250                                  ;	retn
 19251

 19255                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19256                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19257 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19258 00000A20 C3                      	retn

 19324                                  
 19325                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19326                                  ;
 19327                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19328                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19329                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19330                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19331                                  ;
 19332                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19333                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19334                                  ;
 19335                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19336                                  
 19337                                  StartVDHead:
 19338                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19339                                  
 19340 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19341 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19342 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19343 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19344 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19345                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19346 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19347                                  VDiskSig1:
 19348 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19349                                  
 19350                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19351                                  
 19352 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19353                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19354 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19355 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19356 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19357                                  VDInt19:
 19358 00000A75 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19359                                  OldVDInt19:
 19360 00000A76 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19361                                  
 19362                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19363                                  
 19364                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19365 00000A7A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19366                                  VDiskSig2:
 19367 00000A7D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19368                                  
 19369                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19370                                  
 19371 00000A82 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19372 00000A85 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19373 00000A87 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19374 00000A88 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19375 00000A8A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19376 00000A8B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19377 00000A8D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19378 00000A8F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19379 00000A90 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19380 00000A92 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19381 00000A94 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19382 00000A96 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19383 00000A98 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19384                                  
 19385                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19386                                  
 19387                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19388                                  ;
 19389                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19390                                  ;
 19391                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19392                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19393                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19394                                  ;
 19395                                  ; Inputs : None
 19396                                  ;
 19397                                  ; Outputs : None
 19398                                  ;
 19399                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19400                                  ;
 19401                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19402                                  
 19403                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19404                                  
 19405                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19406 00000A9A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19407 00000A9C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19408                                  
 19409                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19410                                  
 19411                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19412 00000A9E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19413                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19414 00000AA1 2EA3[760A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19415 00000AA5 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19416                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19417 00000AA8 2EA3[780A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19418                                  
 19419                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19420

 19523                                  
 19524                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19525                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19526                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19527                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19528                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19529                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19530                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19531                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19532                                  ;								      ;I070
 19533                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19534                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19535                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19536                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19537                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19538                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19539                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19540                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19541                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19542                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19543                                  ;								      ;I070
 19544                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19545                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19546                                  
 19547                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19548                                  	; ds = cs

 20281                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 20282                                  ;									       *
 20283                                  ; function: actually allocate buffers in the memory and initialize it. 	       *
 20284                                  ; input :								       *
 20285                                  ;    memhi:memlo - start of the next available memory			       *
 20286                                  ;    buffers = number of buffers					       *
 20287                                  ;    h_buffers = number of secondary buffers				       *
 20288                                  ;									       *

 20291                                  ;	buffinfo set.							       *

 20295                                  ;									       *

 20298                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 20543                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20544                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20545                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20546                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20547                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20548                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20549                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20550                                  ;
 20551                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20552                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20553                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20554                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20555                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20556                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20557                                  ;
 20558                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20559                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20560                                  ;
 20561                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20562                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20563                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20564                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20565                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20566                                  ;
 20567                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20568                                  ;
 20569                                  ;			  none.
 20570                                  
 20571                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20572                                  ;
 20573                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20574                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20575
