 20752 00001025 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 20753 00001026 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 20754 00001028 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 20755                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 20756                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 20757                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 20758 0000102A BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 20759 0000102D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20760 0000102F CD21                    	int	21h
 20761 00001031 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20762 00001033 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 20763                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 20764                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 20765 00001035 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 20766                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 20767 00001038 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 20768 0000103C B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 20769 0000103E CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 20770                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 20771                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 20772                                  endfile_ret:
 20773 00001040 C3                      	retn
 20774                                  
 20775                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 20776                                  
 20777                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20778                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20779                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20780                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20781                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20782                                  ;
 20783                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20784                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20785                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20786                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20787                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20788                                  ; program).
 20789                                  
 20790                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20791                                  
 20792                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20793                                  
 20794 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20795                                  
 20796                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20797                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20798                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20799                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20800                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20801                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20802                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20803                                  ; carridge return.
 20804                                  
 20805                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20806                                  ;character after =.
 20807                                  
 20808 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20809 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20810 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20811 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20812 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20813                                  
 20814 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20815 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20816 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20817 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20818                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20819 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20820 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20821 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20822 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20823                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20824 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20825 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20826 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20827 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20828 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20829 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20830 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20831                                  done_installparm:
 20832 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20833 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20834 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20835 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20836                                  					; starts with cr.
 20837                                  install_seg_set:
 20838 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20839 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 20840                                  
 20841                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 20842                                  ;
 20843                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 20844                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 20845                                  ;
 20846                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 20847                                  ;
 20848                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 20849                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 20850                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 20851                                  ;
 20852                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20853                                  
 20854                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 20855                                  
 20856                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 20857

 20859                                          ;mov     cx,ax

 20861                                          ;je      short no_envdata2

 20863                                  ;no_envdata2:

 20867                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20868                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 20869                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20870 00001081 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 20871                                  
 20872                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 20873 00001085 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 20874                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20875 00001089 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20876                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20877 0000108D 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20878 00001091 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 20879 00001094 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 20880 00001098 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20881 0000109A B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 20882 0000109C BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 20883 0000109F 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 20884 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20885 000010A1 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20886                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20887                                  
 20888                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20889                                  
 20890                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20891                                  
 20892                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20893                                  
 20894                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20895 000010A6 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20896 000010A7 06                      	push	es
 20897 000010A8 1E                      	push	ds
 20898 000010A9 07                      	pop	es
 20899 000010AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20900 000010AB 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20901                                  
 20902 000010AD 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 20903 000010AE E8AE22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20904 000010B1 5E                      	pop	si
 20905                                  
 20906                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20907                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 20908                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20909                                  	; ds = cs
 20910 000010B2 C3                      	retn
 20911                                  
 20912                                  install_exit_ret:
 20913                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 20914                                  
 20915                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20916                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20917 000010B3 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 20918 000010B5 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 20919 000010B7 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20920 000010BA 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20921 000010BC E89316                  	call    error_line
 20922 000010BF F9                      	stc
 20923                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20924 000010C0 C3                      	retn

 20926                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20927                                  
 20928                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20929                                  ;
 20930                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20931                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20932                                  ;
 20933                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20934                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20935                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20936                                  
 20937                                  ParaRound:
 20938 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20939 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20940 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20941 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20942 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20943 000010CC C3                      	retn
 20944                                  
 20945                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20946                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20947                                  ;
 20948                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20949                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20950                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20951                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20952                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20953                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20954                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20955                                  ;
 20956                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20957                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20958                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20959                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20960                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20961                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20962                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20963                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20964                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20965                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20966                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20967                                  ;
 20968                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20969                                  
 20970                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20971                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20972                                  sysinit_base:				
 20973 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20974 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20975 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20976 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20977 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20978 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20979 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20980 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20981                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20982                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20983 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20984 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20985 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20986                                  
 20987                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20988                                  
 20989 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20990 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 20991 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 20992 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20993 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20994                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20995                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20996                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20997                                  _stall: 
 20998                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20999 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 21000                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21001                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21002 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21003                                  
 21004                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21005 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21006                                  
 21007                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21008                                  
 21009                                  sum_up:
 21010                                  
 21011                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21012                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21013                                  ;
 21014                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21015                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21016                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21017                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21018                                  ;
 21019                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21020                                  
 21021 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21022                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21023                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21024 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21025 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21026 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21027 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21028 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21029                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21030 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21031 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21032                                  sum1:
 21033 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21034 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21035 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21036 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21037                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21038                                  sum_sys_code:
 21039                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21040 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21041                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21042                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21043                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21044                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21045                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21046                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21047                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21048 0000111F B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21049 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21050 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21051                                  sum2:
 21052 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21053 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21054 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21055 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21056 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21057 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21058                                  
 21059                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21060                                  
 21061                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21062                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21063 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21064                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21065                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21066 00001131 0000                    	dw	0
 21067                                  
 21068                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21069                                  
 21070                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 21071

 21080                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21081                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21082                                  ;
 21083                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21084                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21085                                  ;
 21086                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21087                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21088                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21089                                  ;
 21090                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21091                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21092                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21093                                  
 21094                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21095                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21096                                  
 21097                                  set_buffer:
 21098 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21099 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21100 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1

 21102                                  set_buff_1:

 21104                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q

 21107 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 21109 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21110                                  
 21111 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21112 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21113 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21114                                  
 21115                                  ;	for each buffer
 21116                                  
 21117                                  nxt_buff:

 21123

 21125                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21126 00001176 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21127 00001179 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21128                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21129                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21131

 21133 00001181 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 21135 00001183 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21136 00001187 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21137                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21138 0000118B C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21139                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21140 00001190 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21141 00001193 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21142                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21143 00001197 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21144                                  set_buff_2:
 21145 0000119A 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax

 21147 0000119F 2E800E[3614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21153                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21154                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21155                                  ;
 21156                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21157                                  ;
 21158                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21159                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21160                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21161                                  
 21162                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21163                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21164 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21165 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 21166 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21167 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21168                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21169 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21170                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21171                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21172                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21173 000011B6 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21174 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21175 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21176                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21177 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21178 000011BF 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21179 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21180 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21181                                  	;zf=1
 21182                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21183                                  	;zf=1
 21184 000011C7 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21185                                  got_hma:
 21186 000011CC 5A                      	pop	dx
 21187 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 21188 000011CE C3                      	retn

 21190                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21191                                  
 21192                                  set_buffer_info:
 21193                                  
 21194                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21195                                  ;
 21196                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21197                                  ;    ax = di
 21198                                  ;
 21199                                  ;out:
 21200                                  ;    above entries set.
 21201                                  
 21202                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21203 000011CF 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21204                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21205 000011D4 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21206 000011D8 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21207 000011DC 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21208                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21209 000011E1 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 21211 000011E4 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 21213 000011EA 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21214                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21215 000011F0 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 21217                                  
 21218                                  ; ======================================================================
 21219                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21220                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21221                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21222                                  
 21223                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21224                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21225                                  ;
 21226                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21227                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21228                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21229                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21230                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21231                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21232                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21233                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21234                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21235                                  ;
 21236                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21237                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21238                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21239                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21240                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21241                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21242                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21243                                  ;	conditions:
 21244                                  ;
 21245                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21246                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21247                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21248                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21249                                  ;
 21250                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21251                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21252                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21253                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21254                                  ;
 21255                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21256                                  ;
 21257                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21258                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21259                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21260                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21261                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21262                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21263                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21264                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21265                                  ;
 21266                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21267                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21268                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21269                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21270                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21271                                  ;
 21272                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21273                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21274                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21275                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21276                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21277                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21278                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21279                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21280                                  ;
 21281                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21282                                  
 21283                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21284                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21285                                  
 21286                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21287                                  stackinit:
 21288 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21289 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21290 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21291 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21292 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21293 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21294 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21295 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21296 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21297                                  
 21298                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21299                                  
 21300                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21301                                  	; ds = cs
 21302 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21303 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21304                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21305                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21306                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21307 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21308                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21309 00001209 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21310 0000120C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21311                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21312 00001210 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21313                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21314                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21315                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21316 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21317                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21318 00001217 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21319 00001219 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21320                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21321                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21322                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21323 0000121C 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21324                                  
 21325                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21326                                  
 21327                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21328                                  
 21329                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21330                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21331                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21332 00001220 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21333                                  
 21334                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21335                                  
 21336 00001225 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21337                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21338                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21339                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21340 00001228 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21341 0000122A 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21342 0000122C 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21343 00001230 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21344 00001232 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21345                                  
 21346                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21347                                  
 21348 00001235 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21349 0000123A 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21350 0000123E F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21351 00001240 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21352 00001242 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21353 00001244 06                      	push	es
 21354 00001245 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21355                                  
 21356                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21357                                  
 21358 00001246 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21359 0000124A FC                      	cld
 21360 0000124B F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21361                                  
 21362 0000124D 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21363                                  
 21364                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21365                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21366                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21367                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21368                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 22118                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22119                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22120                                  
 22121                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22122                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22123                                  
 22124                                  new_init_loop:
 22125                                  
 22126                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22127                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22128                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22129                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22130                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22131                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22132                                  
 22133 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22134 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22135 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22136 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22137                                  
 22138 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22139                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22140                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22141                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22142 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22143 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22144 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22145 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22146 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22147 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22148 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22149                                  
 22150 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22151 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22152 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22153                                  
 22154                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22155                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22156                                  
 22157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22158                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22159                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22160                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22161                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22162                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22163                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22164                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22165                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22166                                  
 22167                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22168                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22169                                  
 22170                                  setdevmark:
 22171                                  
 22172 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22173 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22174                                  
 22175 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22176 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22177 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22178                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22179                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22180 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22181 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22182                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22183 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22184                                  
 22185 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22186 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22187 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22188 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22189

 22387                                  
 22388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22389                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22390                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22391                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22392                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22393                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22394                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22395                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22396                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22397                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22398                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22399                                  
 22400                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22401                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22402 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22403 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22404 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22405                                  endstruc
 22406                                  
 22407                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22408                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22409                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22410                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22411                                  
 22412                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22413                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22414                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22415                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22416                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22417                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22418                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22419                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22420                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22421                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22422                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22423                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22424                                  
 22425                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22426                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22427 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22428 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22429 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22430                                  endstruc
 22431                                  
 22432                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22433                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22434                                  ;
 22435                                  ;
 22436                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22437                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22438                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22439                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22440                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22441                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22442                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22443                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22444                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22445                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22446                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22447                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22448                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22449                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22450                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22451                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22452                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22453                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22454                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22455                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22456                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22457                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22458                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22459                                  ;	   :
 22460                                  ;
 22461                                  ;Note:
 22462                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22463                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22466                                  ;
 22467                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22468                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22469                                  ;
 22470                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22471                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22472                                  ;
 22473                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22474                                  ;
 22475                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22476                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22477                                  ;
 22478                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22479                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22480                                  ;
 22481                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22482                                  ;
 22483                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22484                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22485                                  ;
 22486                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22487                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22488                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22489                                  ;
 22490                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22491                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22492                                  ;
 22493                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22494                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22495                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22496                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22497                                  
 22498                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22499                                  
 22500                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22501                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22502                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22503                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22504                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22505                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22506                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22507                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22508                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22509                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22510                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22511                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22512                                  
 22513                                  ;**** Function flags
 22514                                  
 22515                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22516                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22517                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22518                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22519                                  
 22520                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22521                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22522 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22523 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22524 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22525 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22526 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22527 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22528                                  endstruc
 22529                                  
 22530                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22531                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22532                                  ;
 22533                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22534                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22535                                  ;	     +-
 22536                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22537                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22538                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22539                                  ;	     |	:
 22540                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22541                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22542                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22543                                  ;	     |	:
 22544                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22545                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22546                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22547                                  ;	     +-	:
 22548                                  ;
 22549                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22550                                  ;
 22551                                  ;Note:
 22552                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22553                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22554                                  ;
 22555                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22556                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22557                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22559                                  
 22560                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22561                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22562                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22563                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22564                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22565                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22566                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22567                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22568                                  
 22569                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22570 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22571 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22572 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22573 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22574 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22575                                  endstruc
 22576                                  
 22577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22578                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22579                                  ;
 22580                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22581                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22582                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22583                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22584                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22585                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22586                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22587                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22588                                  ;
 22589                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22590                                  ;
 22591                                  ;            +-
 22592                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22593                                  ;	    | or
 22594                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22595                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22596                                  ;	    | or
 22597                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22598                                  ;	    | or
 22599                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22600                                  ;	    | or
 22601                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22602                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22603                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22604                                  ;	    | or
 22605                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22606                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22607                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22608                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22609                                  ;	    +-
 22610                                  ;
 22611                                  ;
 22612                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22613                                  ;      list.
 22614                                  ;
 22615                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22616                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22617                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22618                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22619                                  
 22620                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22621                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22622 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22623 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22624 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22625 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22626                                  endstruc

 22633                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22634                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22635                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22636                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22637                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22638                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22639                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22640                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22641                                  
 22642                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 22643

 22645                                  ;
 22646                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 22647                                  
 22648                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 22649                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22650                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22651                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22652                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22653                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22654                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22655                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22656                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22657                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22666 0000143F 0000                    _$P_SI_Save:	   dw	0		;AN000; Pointer of command buffer
 22667 00001441 0000                    _$P_DX:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return result buffer address
 22668 00001443 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)

 22670 00001446 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 22671 00001448 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 22672                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 22673                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 22674

 22676                                  _$P_equ		   equ	01h	      ;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 22677                                  _$P_Neg		   equ	02h	      ;AN000; Negative value

 22679                                  _$P_Key_Cmp	   equ	08h	      ;AN000; set when keyword compare
 22680                                  _$P_SW_Cmp	   equ	10h	      ;AN000; set when switch compare
 22681                                  _$P_Extra	   equ	20h	      ;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 22682                                  _$P_SW		   equ	40h	      ;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 22683                                  _$P_Signed	   equ	80h	      ;AN000; signed numeric specified
 22684

 22686                                  _$P_time12am	   equ	01h	      ;AN038; set when AM is specified on time
 22687                                  _$P_TIME_AGAIN	   equ	02h	      ;AN039; SET WHEN READY TO RE-PARSE TIME
 22688                                  
 22689 0000144A 0000                    _$P_SaveSI_Cmpx:   dw	0		;AN000; save si for later use by complex
