 22741                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22742                                  ; SysParse;
 22743                                  ;
 22744                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22745                                  ;
 22746                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22747                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22748                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22749                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22750                                  ;
 22751                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22752                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22753                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22754                                  ;
 22755                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22756                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22757                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22758                                  ;
 22759                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22760                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22761                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22762                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22763                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22764                                  ;
 22765                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22766                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22767                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22768                                  ;
 22769                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22770                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22771                                  ;
 22772                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22773                                  ;
 22774                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22775                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22776                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22777                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22778                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22779                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22780                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22781                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22782                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22783                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22784                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22785                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22786                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22787                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22788                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22789                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22790                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22791                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22792                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22793                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22794                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22795                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22796                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22797                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22798                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22799                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22800                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22801                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22802                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22803                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22804                                  
 22805                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22806                                  
 22807                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22808                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22809                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22810                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22811                                  
 22812                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22813                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22814                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22815                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22816                                  ;
 22817                                  
 22818                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22819                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22820                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22821                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22822                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22823                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22824                                  
 22825                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22826                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22827                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22828                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22829                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22830                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22831                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22832                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22833                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22834                                  
 22835                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22836                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22837                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22838                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22839                                  ;	     segment.
 22840                                  
 22841                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22842                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22843                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22844                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22845                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22846                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22847                                  
 22848                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22849                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22850                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 22851                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 22852                                  
 22853                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 22854                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 22855                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 22856                                  
 22857                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 22858                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 22859                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 22860                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 22861                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22862                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22863                                  
 22864                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22865                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 22866                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 22867                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 22868                                  
 22869                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 22870                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 22949                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.

 23366                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23367                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23368                                  ;
 23369                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23370                                  ;
 23371                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23372                                  ;	    AL = type
 23373                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23374                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23375                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23376                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23377                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23378                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23379                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23380                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23381                                  ;
 23382                                  ; Output:   None
 23383                                  ;
 23384                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23385                                  ;
 23386                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23387                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23388                                  
 23389                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23395 0000172C 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23396 00001730 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23399                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 23400 00001739 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23401                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 23402 0000173A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 23403 0000173C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 23404                                  
 23405                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;

 23756                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23757                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23758                                  ;
 23759                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23760                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23761                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23762                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23763                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23764                                  ;
 23765                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23766                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23767                                  ;
 23768                                  ; Output:    None
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23771                                  ;
 23772                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23773                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23774                                  
 23775                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23776                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23777                                  
 23778                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23779 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23780 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23781 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23782 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23783 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23784 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23785                                  
 23786 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23787 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23788                                  
 23789 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23790                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23791 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23792                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23793 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23794 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23795 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23796                                  
 23797                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23798                                  
 23799                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23800                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 23801 000018FF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23802 00001900 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23803 00001901 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23804 00001902 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23805 00001903 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 23806 00001905 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23807 00001907 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23808                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23809 00001908 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23810 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 23811 0000190D 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 23812                                  
 23813 0000190F E8F000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 23814 00001912 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 23815                                  
 23816 00001914 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;

 23990                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23991                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 23992                                  ;
 23993                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 23994                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 23995                                  ;
 23996                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 23997                                  ;
 23998                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 23999                                  ;
 24000                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24001                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24002                                  
 24003                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24004                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24005 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24006 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24007 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24008                                  
 24009 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24010 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24011                                  
 24012                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24013 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24014 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24015                                  
 24016 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24017 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24018                                  
 24019                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24020 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24021 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24022

 24573 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24574                                  
 24575                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24576 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24577 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24578                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24579                                  
 24580 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24581                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24582 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24583                                  
 24584 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24585 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24586                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24587 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24588 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24589 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24590                                  
 24591                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24592 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24593 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24594                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24595 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24596 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24597 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24598                                  
 24599 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24600                                  
 24601                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24602 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24603                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24604 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24605 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24606 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24607                                  
 24608                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24609                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24612                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24613                                  ;	    blanks.
 24614                                  ;
 24615                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24616                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24617                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24618                                  ;
 24619                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24620                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24621                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24622                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24623                                  
 24624                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24625 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24626 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24627 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24628                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24629                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24630 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24631 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24632 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24633                                  
 24634 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24635 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24636                                  
 24637 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24638 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24639                                  
 24640                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24641                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24642 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24643 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24644                                  
 24645 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24646 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24647                                  
 24648 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24649 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24650 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24651 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24652                                  
 24653                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24654 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24655                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24656 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24657                                  
 24658                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24659 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24660                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24661 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24662                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24663 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24664 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24665                                  
 24666 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24667                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24668 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24669 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24670 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24671                                  
 24672 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24673                                  
 24674                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24675 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24676                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24677                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24678 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24679 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24680 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24681                                  
 24682                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24683 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24684 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24685 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24686                                  
 24687 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24688                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24689                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24690 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24691 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24692                                  
 24693                                  
 24694                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24695                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24696                                  ;
 24697                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24698                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24699                                  ;
 24700                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24701                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24702                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24703                                  ;
 24704                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24705                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24706                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24707                                  
 24708                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24709                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24710                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24711                                  ;
 24712                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24713                                  
 24714                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24715                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24716                                  
 24717                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24718                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24719 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24720                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24721 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24722 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24723                                  
 24724                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24725 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24726 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24727                                  
 24728 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24729                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24730                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24731 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24732                                  
 24733                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24734                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24735                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24736                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24737                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24738                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24739                                  
 24740                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24741                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24742 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24743 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24744                                  
 24745 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24746                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24747                                  
 24748                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24749                                  	; cf=0
 24750                                  	;retn
 24751                                  
 24752                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24753                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24754                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24755 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24756                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24757                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24758 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24759                                  
 24760                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24761                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24762                                  ;
 24763                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24764                                  ;
 24765                                  ;  Input:
 24766                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24767                                  ;
 24768                                  ;  Output:
 24769                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24770                                  ;
 24771                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24772                                  ;
 24773                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24774                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24775                                  
 24776                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24777 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24778 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24779 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24780                                  	
 24781 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24782 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24783                                  
 24784 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24785 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24786 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24787 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24788 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24789 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24790 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24791 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24792 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24793 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24794 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24795                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24796 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24797 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24798 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24799 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24800 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24801 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24802 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24803 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24804 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24805 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24806                                  
 24807                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24808 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24809 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24810                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24811 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24812 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24813                                  
 24814                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24815 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24816 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24817                                  
 24818 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24819 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24820                                  
 24821 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24822 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24823                                  
 24824 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24825 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24826                                  
 24827                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24828 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24829 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24830                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24831 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24832                                  
 24833                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24834                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24835                                  	; cf=0
 24836                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24837                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24838 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24839 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24840 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24841 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25393                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25394                                  
 25395                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25396                                  
 25397                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25398                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25399                                  
 25400                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25401                                  ;
 25402                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25403                                  ;
 25404                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25405                                  ;
 25406                                  ;   Modification log:
 25407                                  ;
 25408                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25409                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25410                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25411                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25412                                  ;
 25413                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25414                                  ;
 25415                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25416                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25417                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25418                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25419                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25420                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25421                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25422                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25423                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25424                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25425                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25426                                  ;
 25427                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25428                                  
 25429                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25430                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25431                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25432                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25433                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25434                                  
 25435                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25436                                  
 25437                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25438                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25439                                  
 25440                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25441                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25442                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25443                                  
 25444                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25445                                  ;
 25446                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25447                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25448                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25449                                  ;	           line.
 25450                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25451                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25452                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25453                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25454                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25455                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25456                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25457                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25458                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25459                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25460                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25461                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25462                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25463                                  ;	           for details).
 25464                                  
 25465                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25466                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25467                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25468                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25469                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25470                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25471                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25472                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25473                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25474                                  
 25475                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25476                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25477                                  
 25478                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25479                                  
 25480                                  %endif
 25481

 25492 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25493 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25494 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25495 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25496 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25497                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25498                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25499                                  ;
 25500 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25501 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25502 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25503 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25504                                  ;
 25505 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25506                                  ;
 25507 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25508 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25509                                  ;

 25511                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25512 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25513                                  ;
 25514 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25515 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25516 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name

 25591

 25593 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25594 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25595 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25596                                  
 25597                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25598                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25599                                  ;;
 25600                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25601                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25602                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25603                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25604                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25605                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25606                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25607                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25608                                  ;;
 25609                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25610                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25611                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25612                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25613                                  
 25614 00001F5D 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25615                                  	
 25616                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25617                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25618                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25619 00001F60 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25620 00001F64 E870EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25621                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25622                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25623 00001F67 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25624                                   
 25625 00001F6C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25626 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25627                                  
 25628 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25629 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25630 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25631                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25632 00001F79 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25633 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25634 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25635                                  
 25636                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25637                                  
 25638 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25639 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25640 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25641 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25642 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25643 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25644 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25645 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25646                                  
 25647                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25648                                  
 25649 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25650                                  
 25651                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25652                                  
 25653                                  puteol:
 25654 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25655 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25656 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25657 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25658 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25659                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25660                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25661                                  
 25662                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25663                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25664 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25665 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25666                                  
 25667 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25668                                  
 25669 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25670 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25671 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25672                                  
 25673                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25674                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25675                                  	;push	cs
 25676                                  	;pop	ds
 25677                                  
 25678 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25679                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25680 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25681 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25682 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25683 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25684 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25685 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25686 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25687                                  conferr:
 25688 00001FA9 BA[7C34]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25689 00001FAC E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 25690                                  endconv:
 25691 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25692                                  
 25693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25694                                  ;
 25695                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25696                                  ;
 25697                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25698                                  ;
 25699                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25700                                  
 25701                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25702                                  multi_pass:
 25703 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25704 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25705                                  
 25706 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25707                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25708 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25709                                  
 25710                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25711                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25712 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25713 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25714                                  
 25715 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25716 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25717 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25718 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25719 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25720                                  
 25721 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25722 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25723                                  
 25724                                  getcom:
 25725 00001FD5 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25726 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25727                                  conflp: 
 25728 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25729                                  
 25730 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25731                                  
 25732 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25733 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25734 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25735 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25736                                  
 25737                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25738                                  %if 0
 25739                                  
 25740                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25741                                  
 25742                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25743                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25744                                  
 25745                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25746                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25747                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25748                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25749                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25750                                  
 25751                                          push    ax                      ;
 25752                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25753                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25754                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25755                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25756                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25757                                          pop     ax
 25758                                  ;
 25759                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25760                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25761                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25762                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25763                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25764                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25765                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25766                                  ;   spot.
 25767                                  ;
 25768                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25769                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25770                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25771                                  ;   retrieved.
 25772                                  ;
 25773                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25774                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25775                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25776                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25777                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25778                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25779                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25780                                  final:                                  ;
 25781                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25782                                  not_final:                              ;
 25783                                  ;endif
 25784                                  
 25785                                  %endif
 25786 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25787 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25788 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25789                                  
 25790 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25791                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25792                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25793 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25794 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25795                                  	
 25796                                  coff:	
 25797                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25798                                  	; ds = cs
 25799                                  	;push	cs
 25800                                  	;pop	ds
 25801 00002000 E89D10                  	call	newline
 25802 00002003 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 25803                                  
 25804                                  blank_line:
 25805 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25806 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 25807                                  
 25808                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25809                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25810                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25811                                  ;coff_p:
 25812                                  	;push	cs
 25813                                  	;pop	ds
 25814                                  
 25815                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25816                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25817                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25818                                  ;install= command.
 25819                                  
 25820                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25821                                  ;install command
 25822                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25823                                  
 25824                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25825                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25826                                  tryi:
 25827 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25828 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25829 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25830                                  not_init_pass:
 25831 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25832                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25833                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25834 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25835                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25836                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25837                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25838                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25839                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25840                                  					; and before install= commands
 25841                                  					; are processed
 25842                                  
 25843 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25844 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25845 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25846                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25847                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25848 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25849                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25850                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25851                                  
 25852                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25853                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25854                                          
 25855 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25856                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25857                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25858 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25859                                  	
 25860                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25861 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25862                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25863 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25864                                  
 25865                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25866                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25867                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25868                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25869                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25870                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25871                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25872                                  
 25873                                  multi_try_i:
 25874 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25875                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25876                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25877 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25878                                  
 25879                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25880                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25881                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25882                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25883                                  ;;endif
 25884                                  
 25885 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25886 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25887                                  
 25888                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25889                                  %if 0
 25890                                  
 25891                                  multi_try_n:
 25892                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25893                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25894                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25895                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25896                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25897                                  ;endif
 25898                                  
 25899                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25900                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25901                                  
 25902                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25903                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25904                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25905                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25906                                  
 25907                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25908                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25909                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25910                                  
 25911                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25912                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25913                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25914                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25915                                  
 25916                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25917                                  	mov	bx,1
 25918                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25919                                  
 25920                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25921                                  
 25922                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25923                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25924                                          int     21h
 25925                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25926                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25927                                          int     21h
 25928                                  
 25929                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25930                                  
 25931                                  %endif
 25932                                  
 25933                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25934 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25935 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25936 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25937 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25938 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25939 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25940                                  
 25941                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 25942 0000204C FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 25943 00002050 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 25944                                  
 25945                                  multi_pass_coff:
 25946                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25947 00002054 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 25948                                  
 25949                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25950                                  ; buffer command
 25951                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25952                                  
 25953                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25954                                  ;									      *
 25955                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25956                                  ;									      *
 25957                                  ; input :								      *
 25958                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25959                                  ; output:								      *
 25960                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25961                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25962                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25963                                  ;									      *
 25964                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25965                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25966                                  ; logic:								      *
 25967                                  ; {									      *
 25968                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 25969                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25970                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 25971                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25972                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25973                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25974                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 25975                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 25976                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 25977                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 25978                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 25979                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 25980                                  ;	};								      *
 25981                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 25982                                  ; };									      *
 25983                                  ;									      *

 27316                                  ;******************************************************************************

 27318                                  ;									      *
 27319                                  ; input :								      *

 27325                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
